com.tilisty.models

Class AbstractModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tilisty.models.AbstractModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IObservable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TilistyModel, TiProperty, TiViewModel

    public abstract class AbstractModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements IObservable
    This provides the basic observer type infrastructure for this application. The change function should be called with a namespace in order to trigger updates to all IObserver instances that are listening to a particular namespace.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jason Simpson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractModel() 
      AbstractModel(java.lang.Integer[] namespaces)
      What namespaces are being managed by this AbstractModel Pass them in as an array of integers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addObserver(int ns, IObserver observer)
      Adds an IObserver instance to the list of observers.
      void change(int ns)
      Change of an observable value, same as the change event only it calls the tostring method to pass as the message.
      void change(int ns, java.lang.String msg)
      This method goes through all of the IObserver instances which are listnening to this namespace and calls the update method on it passing it a message which is passed in to this function.
      void destroy() 
      void removeObserver(int ns, IObserver observer)

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(int ns,
               IObserver observer)
        Adds an IObserver instance to the list of observers. A namespace must be passed indicating what the observer wants to listen to updates of.
        Specified by:

      • change

        public void change(int ns,
          java.lang.String msg)
        This method goes through all of the IObserver instances which are listnening to this namespace and calls the update method on it passing it a message which is passed in to this function.
